name: Dominick D. MAZZA, Respondent, v. COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION, BUREAU OF DRIVER LICENSING, Petitioner

parties: Dominick D. MAZZA, Respondent, v. COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION, BUREAU OF DRIVER LICENSING, Petitioner.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
AND NOW, this 31st day of March, 1998, the petition for allowance of appeal is denied in accordance with this Court’s decision in Sullivan v. Commonwealth, Department of Transportation, Bureau of Driver Licensing, — Pa. -, 708 A.2d 481 (1998).
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Timothy P. Wile, Asst. Counsel, Harold H. Cramer, Asst. Chief Counsel, Andrew S. Gordon, Chief Counsel, Paul A. Tufano, General Counsel, for petitioner.
casebody.head_matter:
709 A.2d 887
Dominick D. MAZZA, Respondent, v. COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION, BUREAU OF DRIVER LICENSING, Petitioner.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
March 31, 1998.
Timothy P. Wile, Asst. Counsel, Harold H. Cramer, Asst. Chief Counsel, Andrew S. Gordon, Chief Counsel, Paul A. Tufano, General Counsel, for petitioner.
